ilo: Critically reflect on research into how students learn through an emerging understanding of Languages curriculum and theory and implications for effective teaching practice.
Design achievable Languages learning goals, lesson plans and learning sequences, integrating knowledge of student learning, curriculum, assessment, and reporting.

Demonstrate strong Languages subject and pedagogical content knowledge that meets the specific needs of students from diverse backgrounds and promotes participation and inclusion of all students in their learning.
Select and integrate Languages teaching strategies and resources, including ICT, to meet the specific needs of students from diverse backgrounds, and to engage students in their learning.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Report: Written report on pedagogical content knowledge

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
